description: The round payoff this round was 90. You, John chose to play option 1.Kate chose to play option 1. You received a payoff of 45.

Mutual cooperation (choosing option 1) yields the highest individual payoff when both players act in unison, as seen in the example where both chose 1 and received 45 each. This suggests that coordination on option 1 is beneficial for both players

The game resembles a coordination game where players have an incentive to align their strategies to maximize mutual gains. Since mutual cooperation leads to a better outcome than mutual defection (option 2), players might develop strategies to maintain cooperation over multiple rounds

The structure of the payoffs (higher reward for mutual cooperation than mutual defection) encourages players to prioritize cooperation, especially if they can establish trust or a pattern of mutual cooperation in repeated interactions
